card.title: Texas Conducting Audit Of 2020 Election Results

_source.content:
https://www.zerohedge.com/political/texas-conducting-audit-2020-election-results


The office announced the audit last week but declined to provide more details.

Phase one of the review is already underway, the office says. This phase involves verifying the accuracy of voting machines, assessing cybersecurity, and pinpointing and removing from voter rolls any people who cast votes illegally in 2020.

State officials have received reports from the Electronic Registration Information Center regarding voters who may have voted twice or who illegally voted in Texas despite living in another state. In addition, officials have identified votes they say were potentially cast by non-U.S. citizens and alerted counties to review each case. Once that‚Äôs done, any instances of possible illegal voting will be referred to the state Attorney General‚Äôs Office for investigation.

Welcome to the Bible Study group, enjoy the posts and post some edifying content for your brothers and sisters in Christ.

NO SPAM! Stay on topic. A group for study/discussion of the Holy Bible and Jesus. A place to meet and discuss the Scriptures to build up the members of the Body of Christ in doctrine and faith.
     Rules, yes, unfortunately, rules are necessary for obvious reasons.
  Christian content only, having to do with Holy Scripture or the study thereof.
  News articles and commentary, not allowed. There is a Christian News group for that.
  There will be no name-calling, ad hominems, or just plain orneriness allowed.
  
Posting of new-fangled weird doctrines is not allowed. 
So, you ask, "What are weird new-fangled doctrines?" 
Weird new-fangled doctrines are those that have came into popularity beginning in the 19th century, such as those promulgated by:
    Charles Finney, Alexander Campbell, Joseph Smith, William Miller, Ellen G. White, John Nelson Darby, and Cyrus Scofield. Also, the unbiblical teachings of the faith healers, the shabby proclamations of the name it and claim it preachers, the phony new reformation apostles. All these false teachers and false doctrines are forbidden in this Bible Study because they are unbiblical creations of self-serving minds of men and not of God! All post having to do with false doctrines will be removed without hesitation. Any repeat posting of such shall bring about the removal of the offending poster.

This may all seem wrong to some and that is a shame, but this group is for the study of God's word, not for trifling with God's word.

If you have a complaint about the admin in the group email him: lawrenceblair@fastmail.com

card.title: Texas Conducting Audit Of 2020 Election Results

_source.content:
Texas Conducting Audit Of 2020 Election Results
The Texas Secretary of State‚Äôs office is carrying out a forensic audit of 2020 election results in four large counties, including Dallas and Harris counties.
The office announced the audit last week but declined to provide more details.
Phase one of the review is already underway, the office says. This phase involves verifying the accuracy of voting machines, assessing cybersecurity, and pinpointing and removing from voter rolls any people who cast votes illegally in 2020.
State officials have received reports from the Electronic Registration Information Center regarding voters who may have voted twice or who illegally voted in Texas despite living in another state. In addition, officials have identified votes they say were potentially cast by non-U.S. citizens and alerted counties to review each case. Once that‚Äôs done, any instances of possible illegal voting will be referred to the state Attorney General‚Äôs Office for investigation.
Phase two of the audit, estimated to take place in the spring of next year, is centered on examining the election records from various counties, including Tarrant and Collins counties.
The Secretary of State‚Äôs office plans to examine all chain-of-custody forms concerning equipment and all logic and accuracy-testing records for voting machines.
Depending on the results of the examination, there could be a full manual recount in the affected precincts or polling locations.

The Secretary of State‚Äôs office plans to examine all chain-of-custody forms concerning equipment and all logic and accuracy-testing records for voting machines.
Depending on the results of the examination, there could be a full manual recount in the affected precincts or polling locations.
‚ÄúThe purpose of this audit is to ensure all Texas voters can have confidence in the elections systems in our state, and to address any outstanding issues county election officials may face that undermines the integrity of our elections,‚Äù the office said in a statement.

Gas vs Electric Cars
"If you really intend to adopt electric vehicles, you have to face certain realities." "For example, a home charging system for a Tesla requires 75 amp service. The average house is equipped with 100 amp service. On our small street (approximately 25 homes), the electrical infrastructure would be unable to carry more than three houses with a single Tesla each. For even half the homes to have electric vehicles, the system would be wildly over-loaded.
This is the elephant in the room with electric vehicles. Our residential infrastructure cannot bear the load."
So, as our genius elected officials promote this nonsense, not only are we being urged to buy these things and replace our reliable, cheap generating systems with expensive new windmills and solar cells, but we will also have to renovate our entire delivery system! This later "investment" will not be revealed until we're so far down this dead end road that it will be presented with an 'OOPS...!' and a shrug.
Eric test drove the Chevy Volt at the invitation of General Motors and he writes, "For four days in a row, the fully charged battery lasted only 25 miles before the Volt switched to the reserve gasoline engine." Eric calculated the car got 30 mpg including the 25 miles it ran on the battery. So, the range including the 9-gallon gas tank and the 16 kwh battery is approximately 270 miles.
It will take you 4.5 hours to drive 270 miles at 60 mph. Then add 10 hours to charge the battery and you have a total trip time of 14.5 hours. In a typical road trip your average speed (including charging time) would be 20 mph.
According to General Motors, the Volt battery holds 16 kwh of electricity. It takes a full 10 hours to charge a drained battery. The cost for the electricity to charge the Volt is never mentioned, so I looked up what I pay for electricity.
I pay approximately (it varies with amount used and the seasons) $1.16 per kwh. 16 kwh x $1.16 per kwh = $18.56 to charge the battery. $18.56 per charge divided by 25 miles = $0.74 per mile to operate the Volt using the battery. Compare this to a similar size car with a gasoline engine that gets only 32 mpg. $3.19 per gallon divided by 32 Mpg = $0.10 per mile.
The gasoline powered car costs about $25,000 while the Volt costs $46,000 plus. So the Government wants us to pay twice as much for a car, that costs more than seven times as much to run, and takes three times longer to drive across the country.

card.description: WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî A House committee investigating the violent Jan. 6 Capitol insurrection has subpoenaed 11 officials who helped plan rallies in support of former President Donald Trump ahead of the attack, including the massive event on the day of the siege at which the president told his supporters to ‚Äúfight like hell.‚Äù
card.title: House panel subpoenas organizers of Jan. 6 Trump rally

_source.content: House panel subpoenas organizers of Jan. 6 Trump rallyThe Associated Press ^ | September 29, 2021 | By MARY CLARE JALONICK and ERIC TUCKERhttps://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-capitol-siege-subpoenas-bennie-thompson-80ec35af0b8655b8c0a2e46675577a83WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî A House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol insurrection has subpoenaed 11 officials who were involved in planning rallies in support of former President Donald Trump ahead of the violent attack, including one the day of the siege at which the president told his supporters to ‚Äúfight like hell.‚ÄùThe announcement follows a first round of subpoenas last week that targeted former White House and administration officials who were in contact with Trump before and during the insurrection.The committee said in a release Wednesday that the subpoenas are part of the panel‚Äôs efforts to collect information from the organizers ‚Äúand their associated entities on the planning, organization, and funding of those events.‚Äù Mississippi Rep. Bennie Thompson, the chairman of the committee, said ‚Äúthe inquiry includes examination of how various individuals and entities coordinated their activities leading up to the events of January 6.‚ÄùThe letters from Thompson cite efforts by representatives of the group Women for America First to organize the rally on Jan. 6 and to collectively communicate with senior White House officials. The subpoenas also mention other events the group planned in the weeks between Trump‚Äôs November election defeat and the January attack.Among those from whom the committee is seeking information is Caroline Wren, a veteran GOP fundraiser who was named as a ‚ÄúVIP Advisor‚Äù on an attachment to the permit that Women for America First submitted. During the campaign, she was a national finance consultant for Trump Victory, a joint fundraising committee between the president‚Äôs reelection campaign and the Republican National Committee.The AP has previously reported that Wren was involved in at least one call before the pro-Trump rally with members of several groups listed as rally participants to organize credentials for VIP attendees.

House panel subpoenas organizers of Jan. 6 Trump rally
The Associated Press ^ | September 29, 2021 | By MARY CLARE JALONICK and ERIC TUCKER
https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-capitol-siege-subpoenas-bennie-thompson-80ec35af0b8655b8c0a2e46675577a83

WASHINGTON (AP) ‚Äî A House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol insurrection has subpoenaed 11 officials who were involved in planning rallies in support of former President Donald Trump ahead of the violent attack, including one the day of the siege at which the president told his supporters to ‚Äúfight like hell.‚Äù

The announcement follows a first round of subpoenas last week that targeted former White House and administration officials who were in contact with Trump before and during the insurrection.

The committee said in a release Wednesday that the subpoenas are part of the panel‚Äôs efforts to collect information from the organizers ‚Äúand their associated entities on the planning, organization, and funding of those events.‚Äù Mississippi Rep. Bennie Thompson, the chairman of the committee, said ‚Äúthe inquiry includes examination of how various individuals and entities coordinated their activities leading up to the events of January 6.‚Äù

The letters from Thompson cite efforts by representatives of the group Women for America First to organize the rally on Jan. 6 and to collectively communicate with senior White House officials. The subpoenas also mention other events the group planned in the weeks between Trump‚Äôs November election defeat and the January attack.

Among those from whom the committee is seeking information is Caroline Wren, a veteran GOP fundraiser who was named as a ‚ÄúVIP Advisor‚Äù on an attachment to the permit that Women for America First submitted. During the campaign, she was a national finance consultant for Trump Victory, a joint fundraising committee between the president‚Äôs reelection campaign and the Republican National Committee.

The AP has previously reported that Wren was involved in at least one call before the pro-Trump rally with members of several groups listed as rally participants to organize credentials for VIP attendees.

card.description: After so much dialogue, tolerance, and compromise, the majority of faithful people now lack the capacity to defend themselves against oppressive systems.
card.title: How Making Christianity A 'Nice People Club' Is Destroying The Church

_source.content: https://thefederalist.com/2021/09/30/vaccine-mandates-are-just-the-latest-example-of-religious-indifference-destroying-the-church/‚¨ÜÔ∏è Full StoryBy Auguste MeyratSEPTEMBER 30, 2021How Turning Christianity Into A ‚ÄòNice People Club‚Äô Is Destroying The ChurchAfter so much dialogue, tolerance, and compromise, the majority of faithful people now lack the capacity to defend themselves against oppressive systems.Complying with increased enforcement of COVID-19 restrictions in the Canadian province of New Brunswick, Archbishop Valery Vienneau has limited the celebration of Mass to those who have been vaccinated. Although ‚Äúfewer than 50 people have died from COVID-19,‚Äù and imposing mass segregation clearly violates the rights to freedom and equality, both church and civil authorities thought it would be a prudent move to coerce people into taking the jab and presumably slow the spread of the virus.In other news, Pope Francis took issue with an unnamed Catholic television network (reportedly EWTN), calling it ‚Äúthe work of the devil.‚Äù Evidently, the station produced programming critical of the pope and even received official complaints from the Vatican.That said, the station has also been a powerful tool for evangelization and a great resource for Catholics to learn more about the faith. One wonders how the pope is comfortable condemning a Catholic TV network in the harshest terms while complimenting a brutal and murderous regime like the Chinese Communist Party.So what do these two news items have in common besides having to do with the Catholic Church? They are both a result of the same phenomenon that has plagued the church and nearly every other political and cultural institution in the developed world: deadly indifference.I take this term from the new book from Catholic writer and editor Eric Sammons who explains how the church went from being a large, influential community of practicing Christians to a hollowed-out cultural relic run by out-of-touch Boomers. In short, he argues that church leaders in the 1960s took radical measures to ‚Äúopen up‚Äù to different viewpoints and practices. ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Full Story

By Auguste Meyrat
SEPTEMBER 30, 2021

How Turning Christianity Into A ‚ÄòNice People Club‚Äô Is Destroying The Church

After so much dialogue, tolerance, and compromise, the majority of faithful people now lack the capacity to defend themselves against oppressive systems.

Complying with increased enforcement of COVID-19 restrictions in the Canadian province of New Brunswick, Archbishop Valery Vienneau has limited the celebration of Mass to those who have been vaccinated. Although ‚Äúfewer than 50 people have died from COVID-19,‚Äù and imposing mass segregation clearly violates the rights to freedom and equality, both church and civil authorities thought it would be a prudent move to coerce people into taking the jab and presumably slow the spread of the virus.

In other news, Pope Francis took issue with an unnamed Catholic television network (reportedly EWTN), calling it ‚Äúthe work of the devil.‚Äù Evidently, the station produced programming critical of the pope and even received official complaints from the Vatican.

That said, the station has also been a powerful tool for evangelization and a great resource for Catholics to learn more about the faith. One wonders how the pope is comfortable condemning a Catholic TV network in the harshest terms while complimenting a brutal and murderous regime like the Chinese Communist Party.

So what do these two news items have in common besides having to do with the Catholic Church? They are both a result of the same phenomenon that has plagued the church and nearly every other political and cultural institution in the developed world: deadly indifference.

I take this term from the new book from Catholic writer and editor Eric Sammons who explains how the church went from being a large, influential community of practicing Christians to a hollowed-out cultural relic run by out-of-touch Boomers. In short, he argues that church leaders in the 1960s took radical measures to ‚Äúopen up‚Äù to different viewpoints and practices. In effect, they became ‚Äúindifferent‚Äù to frequently incompatible systems of thought.

As Sammons points out, Catholic teaching itself stayed the same, but the emphasis of that teaching changed in important ways. No longer would Catholics proclaim their faith to the world; they would now foster two-way dialogues with everyone.

No longer would they set themselves apart from other faiths and things of the world; they would now seek common ground in the interest of world peace and mutual understanding. No longer would they insist on being disciples of Christ to attain salvation; they would insist on following one‚Äôs conscience and trust in a loving (and remarkably indulgent) God.

Trump: Dems' CR 'Snuck' in 'Unlimited Money' for Afghans; Oppose It

By Eric Mack | Thursday, 30 September 2021 12:44 PM

In a scathing rebuke Thursday, former President Donald Trump noted he "just found" language "snuck" into the Democrats' Continuing Resolution that provides "unlimited money to random, unscreened, unvetted Afghan nationals," including any who "used to live there."

Trump wrote in a statement from his Save America PAC: "Snuck into the government funding bill, or CR, the Democrats are trying to pass, and just found, is unlimited money to random, unscreened, unvetted Afghan nationals. Republicans can't let this happen. This is a further insult after Biden's humiliating withdrawal from Afghanistan, that needlessly killed 13 Americans."

The CR is Congress' attempt to avoid a government shutdown before Oct. 1 amid a failure to pass a 2022 budget to fund the government. The vote is to come later Thursday and Liz Harrington echoed Trump's alarm via Twitter on giving "unlimited welfare to Afghan nationals," calling it "a slap in the face after Biden's humiliating withdrawal that left Americans behind."

Trump's statement continued:

"This is not a 'clean' government funding bill. It's a major immigration rewrite that allows Biden to bring anyone he wants from Afghanistan for the next year ‚Äî no vetting, no screening, no security ‚Äî and fly them to your community with free welfare and government-issued IDs. We've already seen some of the horrible assaults and sex crimes that have taken place. But these terrible assaults will just be the tip of the iceberg of what's coming if this isn't shut down."

Trump added outrage that the CR funding even applies to Afghan nationals who "used to live there," pinning blame squarely on President Joe Biden, embattled Secretary of State Antony Blinken and "incompetent radical" Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas, concluding his statement:

"The CR even covers people who don't live in Afghanistan and haven't in many years, as long as they used to live there. So Biden and Blinken can load up planes of former Afghans from Pakistan or elsewhere without any limits, checks or even a lawful visa or refugee status. The only 'rule' is that Mayorkas ‚Äî an incompetent radical ‚Äî give them a green light. This bill must be opposed!"

Republicans in Congress have frequently pointed to Blinken running the "noncombatant evacuation" phase of the Afghanistan withdrawal and DHS's Mayorkas as the orchestrator migration crisis at the southern border.

card.description: Sen. Joe Manchin (D-W.Va.), on the eve of a voting deadline for the Democratic leadership's $3.5 trillion spending ...
card.title: Manchin Says Democrats' $3.5 Trillion Budget Bill Remains 'Fiscal Insanity‚Äô on Eve of Vote

_source.content:
Warning - It's more than the $3T price tag, Gabbers!

If #BeijingBiden is looking at infrastructure - think about that - what's he sending overseas or bringing here? Can you imagine if our infrastructure is turned against us?

Remember he specifically used the word UNIONS in his Executive Order and in his Build Back Cock & Bull Plan. Don't you know there is a person already in the bullpen warming up for this position!

üëâAlso we know electric vehicles and those stupid batteries are no better for our environment and could be even worse. At the end of the manufacturing process, electric cars are the ones generating more carbon emissions, according to the Union of Concerned Scientists. (I will address that in another post.)

"Today, building on these efforts, the Administration released findings from the comprehensive 100-day supply chain assessments for four critical products: ...large capacity batteries, like those for electric vehicles; critical minerals and materials; and pharmaceuticals and active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs)."

There is a minerals site outside of China he is claiming will be used for combating Climate Crisis? SRSLY?

"The Department of Defense (DOD) has announced an investment in the expansion of the largest rare earth element mining and processing company outside of China to provide the raw materials necessary to help combat the climate crisis."

üëâHow does pulling minerals out of the earth near China combat a nonexistent crisis?üëà

These traitors have had teams - focus groups - think tanks targeting every single industry, our every keystroke, on earth and in space watching, recording and strategizing the takedown of our country and our Constitution and to take more and more money from us.

I'm sure supercomputers have been weaponized too to crunch the numbers. Can supercomputers be programmed to win elections worldwide? I think so!!

Look at the heads of these corporations and attorneys like Marc Elias, Eric Holder and Keith Ellison on their payroll. None of these people are doing great things for all of humanity and/or Mother earth.

Let's face it - the same types of people crying "Environment, Climate and Global Warming have been ruling and pillaging the earth and concocting chemicals and gasses to kill, maim and sterlize.

_source.content:
1 of 2 -
Stuff can point towards The Lord all day long but if it happens to be a human doing the pointing while stating he or she is the only way to properly hear from The
Lord, it‚Äôs not The Lord, it‚Äôs a cult. That translates to, ‚ÄúRun...fast.‚Äù

There are dozens of cults. A ‚Äúcult‚Äù is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong ‚ÄúJesus‚Äù but that‚Äôs beside the point) but it fails to follow Him and
Him ALONE. There‚Äôs ALWAYS someone else as a ‚Äúleader‚Äù. Examples: Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, Charles ‚ÄúTaze‚Äù Russell of Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses, Mary Baker Eddy of
Christian Science, Eric von Anderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles (S8W), Ellen White of Seventh Day Adventism, the Virgin Mary of Roman Catholicism, Moses of the
Hebrew Roots Movement, and so on. ‚ÄúSalvation by works‚Äù never works. No one is saved BY good works but rather UNTO them.

A trivia note regarding SDA: Anyone remember Waco, Texas? David Koresh? The media would always refer to ‚ÄúThe Branch Davidians‚Äù. That‚Äôs actually the abbreviated name
in reality. The full name is ‚ÄúThe Branch Davidian Seventh Day Adventists‚Äù.

Matthew 7:21-23 (GW)
‚ÄúNot everyone who says to me, ‚ÄòLord, Lord!‚Äô will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the person who does what my Father in heaven wants. Many will say to me on that
day, ‚ÄòLord, Lord, didn‚Äôt we prophesy in your name? Didn‚Äôt we force out demons and do many miracles by the power and authority of your name?‚Äô Then I will tell them
publicly, ‚ÄòI‚Äôve never known you. Get away from me, you evil people.‚Äô(‚Äù)
Mark 1:15 (GW)
He said, ‚ÄúThe time has come, and God‚Äôs kingdom is near. Change the way you think and act, and believe the Good News.‚Äù
John 14:6 (GW)
Jesus answered him, ‚ÄúI am the way, the truth, and the life. No one goes to the Father except through me.(‚Äù)
John 19:30 (GW)
After Jesus had taken the vinegar, he said, ‚ÄúIt is finished!‚Äù Then he bowed his head and died.
Romans 5:10 (GW)
If the death of his Son restored our relationship with God while we were still his enemies, we are even more certain that, because of this restored relationship, the
life of his Son will save us.
Galatians 2:20 (GW)
I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live I live by believing in God‚Äôs Son, who loved me and took the punishment for my sins.
Colossians 2:13-14 (GW)
You were once dead because of your failures and your uncircumcised corrupt nature. But God made you alive with Christ when he forgave all our failures. He did this by
erasing the charges that were brought against us by the written laws God had established. He took the charges away by nailing them to the cross.
Hebrews 10:14 (GW)
With one sacrifice he accomplished the work of setting them apart for God forever.
2 Timothy 3:5 (GW)
They will appear to have a godly life, but they will not let its power change them. Stay away from such people.
